biography.full:
Illaoi’s powerful physique is dwarfed only by her indomitable faith. As the prophet of the Great Kraken, she uses a huge, golden idol to rip her foes’ spirits from their bodies and shatter their perception of reality. All who challenge the “Truth Bearer of Nagakabouros” soon discover Illaoi never battles alone - the god of the Serpent Isles fights by her side.

All who encounter Illaoi are struck by her presence. An intense woman, the priestess is fully committed to the experience of living. She takes what she wants, destroys what she hates, and revels in everything she loves.

However, to truly know Illaoi you must understand the religion she has devoted her life to. Nagakabouros, the deity of her faith, is usually depicted as an enormous serpent head with tentacles spiraling around it in endless motion, with no beginning and no end. Also called The Mother Serpent, The Great Kraken, or even The Bearded Lady, Nagakabouros is the Serpent Isles’ god of life, ocean storms, and motion. (The literal translation of its name is “the unending monster that drives the sea and sky.”) Central to the religion’s theology are three tenets: every spirit was born to serve the universe; desire was built into every living being by the universe; the universe only moves toward its destiny when living creatures chase their desires.

Lesser priestesses are tasked with maintaining temples, calling holy serpents, and teaching people the ways of Nagakabouros. As the religion’s Truth Bearer, Illaoi’s role is to serve the god directly by unblocking the flow of the universe. To this end, she has two sacred responsibilities.

The first duty of a Truth Bearer is to be the spearhead in the war against undeath. Having fallen outside of the normal flow of the universe, the undead are considered an abomination against Nagakabouros. While it is the responsibility of every priestess of the Kraken to protect the indigenous population from the Harrowing, a Truth Bearer directly engages its most powerful spirits and drives the Black Mist back.

Second, Illaoi is tasked with seeking out individuals of great potential and challenging them with the Test of Nagakabouros. This task is the burden Illaoi’s title reflects. With her massive, holy relic, The Eye of God, the Truth Bearer strips the subject’s spirit from their body then forces them to stand against her to prove their worth. She does this knowing those who fail will be completely annihilated, for the great Kraken has no tolerance for cowardice, doubt, or restraint. But destruction is never the goal. Survivors of the ordeal are forever changed and often find the will to pursue their true destiny.

Though Illaoi is the most powerful and respected Truth Bearer in a hundred generations, it is where she has broken the traditions of her faith that speaks the most about her. Having completed her training as a Truth Bearer, and at the height of her power, Illaoi left the golden temples of Buhru for the squalor of nearby Bilgewater.

The pirate city is the only place foreigners are permitted on the Serpent Isles, viewed as a fetid gutter by Illaoi’s people. Previous Truth Bearers ignored the city and viewed the arriving foreigners as little better than untouchables. Illaoi broke with tradition when she chose to protect residents of Bilgewater from the Harrowing, or even more controversially when she decided that some of its residents had souls worthy of the great test. Despite this, only a handful of temples have been opened in the city, and very few paylangi (islander slang for residents of mainlander descent) have ever been permitted inside. Regardless, it is Illaoi who has brought the widespread awareness of the Mother Serpent to Bilgewater, and it is her indomitable spirit that has brought her religion into favor there.

Rumors persist that Bilgewater’s most bloodthirsty and infamous pirate had his heart broken by the towering priestess. To anyone who has ever met her, this is no surprise. Illaoi’s rough manner belies subtle intelligence, strength, and a magnetic confidence.

Many seek Illaoi’s favor and welcome her to Bilgewater... yet everyone fears being tested by the Kraken’s Prophet.

“There can be no rest. We are the motion.”

—From The Twenty Wisdoms of Nagakabouros
biography.short: Illaoi’s powerful physique is dwarfed only by her indomitable faith. As the prophet of the Great Kraken, she uses a huge, golden idol to rip her foes’ spirits from their bodies and shatter their perception of reality. All who challenge the “Truth Bearer of Nagakabouros” soon discover Illaoi never battles alone—the god of the Serpent Isles fights by her side.
biography.quote: “Wisdom is frequently a kick in the head.”

modules.title: The Climb
modules.description: The 2018 season is here. Take the first step and begin your climb.

modules.title: Trial of the Kraken Priestess
modules.description: Fight for your soul. If you have the courage.

modules.title: The Burden
modules.description: “Truth Bearer, this is why we must retreat to Buhru. We cannot save the paylangi,” the Hierophant said. The heavy-set woman grinned, obviously pleased by the prospect of leaving Bilgewater.

title.th_th: การเริ่มต้นใหม่

description.cs_cz: Jelikož se Bilgewater potýká s obecným nedostatkem stavebního materiálu, byl z velké části vybudován ze všeho, co zdejší obyvatelé dokázali přinést, najít nebo ukrást – ať už se jedná o kamenné kvádry ze starších budov nebo rozbité kýly lodí, na kterých sami dorazili.
description.de_de: Mangels natürlicher Bauressourcen wurde ein großer Teil von Bilgewasser aus allen möglichen Dingen gebaut, die Leute heranbringen, finden oder stehlen konnten – von umfunktioniertem Mauerwerk bis hin zu den demolierten Rümpfen ihrer einstigen Schiffe.
description.el_gr: Λόγω της έλλειψης φυσικών οικοδομικών υλικών, το μεγαλύτερο μέρος του Μπίλτζγουοτερ χτίστηκε με ό,τι μπορούσε να φέρει, να βρει ή να κλέψει ο καθένας —από ειδικά διαμορφωμένα πέτρινα ερείπια μέχρι τα σπασμένα κουφάρια των πλοίων με τα οποία είχαν ταξιδέψει.
description.en_au: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.en_gb: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.en_ph: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.en_pl: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.en_sg: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.en_us: Lacking natural resources for construction, much of Bilgewater has been built up with whatever people can bring, find, or steal—be it repurposed masonry, or even the broken hulls of the ships they traveled in.
description.es_ar: A falta de recursos naturales para la construcción, gran parte de Aguasturbias se construyó con todo aquello que la gente pudo llevar, encontrar o robar, desde mampostería reciclada hasta incluso los cascos rotos de los barcos en los que navegaron.
description.es_es: Debido a la carencia de recursos naturales con los que construir, Aguas Estancadas se ha levantado con lo que la gente podía aportar, encontrar o robar, ya sea mampostería improvisada o los cascos rotos de las naves en las que viajaban.
description.es_mx: A falta de recursos naturales para la construcción, gran parte de Aguasturbias se construyó con todo aquello que la gente pudo llevar, encontrar o robar, desde mampostería reciclada hasta incluso los cascos rotos de los barcos en los que navegaron.
description.fr_fr: Manquant de ressources naturelles pour sa construction, Bilgewater a été bâtie avec tout ce que ses habitants avaient pu apporter, trouver ou voler, comme d'anciennes constructions recyclées, ou même les coques des navires qui les avaient menés jusqu'ici.
description.hu_hu: Természetes építőanyagok híján Bilgewater java része abból épült, amit lakói találtak, ideszállítottak vagy elloptak valahonnan: innen-onnan összehordott téglákból vagy akár sérült hajók törzséből.
description.it_it: In assenza delle risorse naturali per le costruzioni, buona parte di Bilgewater è costruita con i materiali portati, trovati o rubati dagli abitanti, dalle pietre di recupero agli scafi distrutti delle navi.
description.ja_jp: 天然の建築資源に乏しいビルジウォーターの大部分は、石材の使いまわしやかつて航海に使用された船の残骸など、そのことごとくが人々により見つけられ、回収され、あるいは盗まれてきたもので造られている。
description.ko_kr: 천연 건축 자재가 부족한 빌지워터는 찾거나, 구하거나, 훔칠 수 있는 모든 자재를 동원해서 건설한 도시입니다. 재료는 건물의 벽돌부터 부서진 선체까지 다양합니다.
description.pl_pl: Z powodu braku naturalnych zasobów budowlanych większość Bilgewater została zbudowana z wszystkiego, co ludzie są w stanie przynieść, znaleźć lub ukraść — czy to z murów, którym znaleziono inne zastosowanie, czy z połamanych kadłubów statków, w których podróżowali.
description.pt_br: Pela falta de recursos naturais para construções, boa parte de Águas de Sentina foi construída com o que as pessoas conseguiram trazer, achar ou roubar, desde alvenaria de demolição até os cascos dos navios em que vieram.
description.ro_ro: Având puține resurse naturale pentru construcții, o mare parte din Bilgewater a fost construită cu ceea ce oamenii au adus, găsit sau furat, începând de la zidărie refolosită și ajungând până la bucăți din navele cu care au sosit pe mare.
description.ru_ru: В Билджвотере не хватает природных ресурсов для строительства, поэтому большая часть города сооружалась из того, что будущие жители сумели привезти с собой, найти или украсть. В ход пошло все, от разобранной каменной кладки до разбитых каркасов кораблей, в которых они путешествовали.
description.th_th: เมือง Bilgewater ไม่ค่อยมีทรัพยากรที่สามารถนำมาสร้างสิ่งก่อสร้างได้มากนัก ฉะนั้นผู้คนจึงสร้างเมืองนี้ขึ้นมาจากทุก ๆ อย่างที่สามารถนำ หา หรือขโมยมาได้—ไม่ว่าจะเป็นอิฐที่ถูกนำมาเรียงใหม่ หรือแม้แต่ซากปรักพักพังของเรือที่พวกเขาเดินทางมา
description.tr_tr: Bilgewater'da inşaatta kullanılabilecek doğal kaynaklar yok. Bu yüzden şehrin büyük kısmı halkın yanında getirebildiği, bulabildiği ya da çalabildiği malzemelerden inşa edilmiş. Başka binalardan alınmış taşlara, hatta buraya gelirken bindikleri gemilerin kırık omurgalarına kadar her şey kullanılmış.
description.vn_vn: Do thiếu vật liệu xây dựng, phần lớn Bilgewater được hình thành từ bất kỳ thứ gì người dân mang đến, tìm ra, hay trộm được—đó có thể là đá tảng, hoặc thậm chí xác tàu họ từng đi trên đó.
description.zh_cn: 由于缺少建筑用的自然资源，大多数比尔吉沃特的建筑材料都是人们带来、找来或偷来的——既有挪为它用的石刻作品，甚至还有他们乘坐而来的船只报废后的船壳。
description.zh_tw: 比爾吉沃特缺乏建築專用的自然資源，大多數建築物的資源都是透過人們帶來、找來或偷來的 －無論是改造過的砌石，甚至是他們用來航行的船隻報廢後的船殼。

modules.title: Shadow and Fortune
modules.subtitle: by Graham McNeill
modules.description: The Butcher Blades had hung the Jackdaw from a rusted marlinspike through his jawbone and left him for the quayside scavengers. This was the seventeenth murdered ganger the hooded man had seen tonight.

modules.title: Champion Insights: Illaoi
modules.description: We met up with some of the folks behind Illaoi’s creation to find out how they turned some early ideas into the battle priestess preparing to test the Rift. Here’s their story.
